intro: Psychotria chasaliifolia, commonly known as the Chasalii Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
